page.title: 05HOUSING
page.content:
HOUSING
In appearance, the flint and brick cottages of Stanhoe seem not to have changed very much but in fact this is deceptive, for the rows and yards which in the past housed many large families in c1950 have been updated so that the houses now provide quite substantial and compact homes. With the falling population this has been an acceptable change. There has recently been the addition of four old peoples' bungalows. The rows of Council houses have stood for thirty and fifty years. Within the last few years new houses have been and are still being built, some large for their small plots, some bungalows, and a terrace of three. Altogether there have been twelve additions since 1980.
